text:
radio Broadcasting stations
WSUI and KSUI (FM)
STATE UNIVERSITY OF IOWA
Iowa City
January 27, 1961
Mr. Wm. G. Harley
President, NAEB
13^6 Connecticut Ave., N.W.
Washington 6
D.C.
Dear Bills
This refers to your communication of January 24 directed to
NAEB Board Members regarding NAEEWJCETMJETRC relations.
Congratulations on a start toward a mutual understanding of
NAEB and NETBC functions. I think we *ve needed this for a
good long time.
One thing disturbs me: Page 2, next to the last paragraph,
3* Station Activation
Primary responsibility for activation of additional
educational stations, methods of interconnection thereof,
and new patterns of program distribution will rest with
the Center.
Does this mean that NAEB will not concern itself with the
activation of new educational stations, either radio or TV,
or with such things as networks, for either radio or TV,
involving such things as wire line, PM or microwave relay?
I think these things could be extremely important, NABB has
done considerable pioneering, and I*d hate to see it given
up.
Sincerely,
Carl H. Menzer
Director
/
CM:hm
